title: Em Dash
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019082620/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019082620/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology)/ [Characters](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019082620/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Characters) : Em Dash**

A horizontal line character one [em](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019082620/http:/typophile.com/wiki/em) in width. Commonly use to imply a break in thought, or missing content.

Used to indicate a sudden break in thought, or to show an open range such as in numbers or dates.

[Unicode](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019082620/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Unicode) : 2014  
Windows US Keyboard : Alt 0151  
Macintosh US Keyboard : Shift Option -
